Authors:
Naoki Endo, Miyuki Kodaira, Akiyoshi Yamada, Eiji
Nagasawa
Title:
Amanita ishigakiensis sp. nov., new species of section
Caesareae from Ishigaki Island, Japan, and its multi-locus
phylogeny
Keywords:
Basidiomata morphology, CaesarÂ’s mushroom, Ectomycorrhiza,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
New species of Amanita section Caesareae, A. ishigakiensis
sp. nov. was described from Ishigaki Island, Japan. This species is
characterized by yellowish to brownish pileus surface, indistinct umbo
of pileus center, marginated lamellae, broadly ellipsoid to ellipsoid
basidiospores, short basidia, colorless cells on the lamellar edge, and
small chlamidospore-like terminal cells in volval surface. Similar
species, A. rubromarginata, A. chatamagotake, A. kitamagotake, and A.
javanica were morphologically distinct from A. ishigakiensis.
Phylogenetic analysis of internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region and
large subunit (LSU) regions of fungal ribosomal RNA gene, translation
elongation factor 1-alpha (tef-1) region, and RNA polymerase II subunit
II (rpb2) supported that A. ishigakiensis is distinct from any
previously described species of sect. Caesareae.
